pacheco-etal-2022-hands.title: Hands-On Interactive Neuro-Symbolic NLP with DRaiL
pacheco-etal-2022-hands.author:
Pacheco, Maria Leonor  and
Roy, Shamik  and
Goldwasser, Dan
pacheco-etal-2022-hands.paperMotivationText: This paper probes DRaiL, a declarative neuro-symbolic modeling framework designed to support a wide variety of NLP scenarios.
pacheco-etal-2022-hands.paperContributionText: The authors enhance DRaiL with an easy to use Python interface equipped with methods to define, modify and augment models interactively, as well as with methods to debug and visualize the predictions made.
pacheco-etal-2022-hands.paperResultsText: The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of the framework/the interface with two challenging NLP tasks: analyzing moral sentiment in political discourse, and analyzing opinions about the Covid-19 vaccine.
pacheco-etal-2022-hands.dataYesCommentText: All Datasets are from the paper "Modeling Content and Context with Deep Relational Learning"
